alert.note: Alert for Menominee (Michigan) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 05 at 4:46PM EDT by NWS Marquette
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 645 PM CDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of central Upper Michigan, including the following county, Menominee. * WHEN...Until 645 PM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 346 PM CDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to showers and thunderstorms. Rapid river rises will cause minor flooding in the advisory area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Menominee, Birch Creek, Carbondale and Arthur Bay. - www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
